AvidXchange is distinguished as a global fintech unicorn and one of the fastest growing technology companies in the U.S. with 1,400 employees supporting customers across seven office locations. Our employees live by our core values, including “Innovate to Change the Game”, “Passion about Customer Success”, “Win as a Team”, “Play to our Strengths”, and “Have a Blast”. We are on a mission to create something different at AvidXchange. Come join the team!

Job Overview

The Senior Data Architect is responsible for the overall state-of-the-art data platform and advanced analytical data architecture, which are fully aligned with business and data monetization strategy, leveraging advanced data techniques including artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science. The Senior Data Architect will develop a strategy to improve the value of data, improve effectiveness of information stewardship, and streamline the flow of data within the organization and to our customers. This position is accountable for partnering with key roles (e.g. product owners, engineers, architects, etc.) to understand the details of Product enhancements and technical process initiatives, for creating and maintaining technical designs that align with AvidXchange's overall technical principles and strategy, and for mentoring and guiding engineers and other Architects on these architectural designs and technology standards during construction.

Job Responsibilities


Determine overall data modeling standards, guidelines, best practices and approved modeling techniques.
Lead overall data architecture and exert influence across all cross-functional teams including data

engineering, business intelligence, data science, and data integration teams


Lead the data design of solutions for large projects and programs, through expert knowledge, translating high-level business requirements into data models and appropriate metadata, test data, and data standards.
Drive the design of conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support transactional and analytical systems.
Lead and participate in the peer review and quality assurance of project architectural data artifact, influence key architecture decisions and report implications to the architectural governance forums.
knowledge and understanding of an entire line of business or infrastructure sub-domain
Ensure all relevant project teams follow a common set of data principles and patterns, utilize a standard set of technology frameworks, and apply data architecture best practices that helps increase quality and agility.
Provide thought leadership across the data community to ensure solutions are built in alignment with platform principles, design patterns, and standards.
Develop data architectures that are inherently secure, robust, resilient, scalable, and enable API-centric and microservices ecosystem.
Define data infrastructure and deployment topology by working with peers across the technology organization to support continuous integration and deployment, and DevOp(s) processes.
Identify the data assets that are deemed significant to the enterprise, as determined by the business impact, decision impact, risk mitigation or organizational impact of the information
Identify emerging data technologies and develop architectural roadmaps to modernize technology landscape and drive innovation.

Education, Skills and Qualification

Required Experience, Qualifications, and Skills


Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, 12+ years in information technology and 5+ years data architecture experience across OLTP, reporting, analytics and/or data science.
Prior work experience as a Data Architect, Data Modeler, Data Scientist, Data Analyst or similar roles.
Extensive experience with enterprise data architecture for transactional systems, analytical platforms, information life cycle management, master data management, data governance framework, data replication, data integration and large-scale data migration.
Understanding of database structure and modeling principles
Experience gathering and analyzing non-functional requirements and designing world class performing data solutions
Deep experience with relational and non-relational data platforms, Data Lake concepts, modern ETL/ELT Automation Techniques, Data Cataloging, etc.
Extensive experience with machine learning, artificial intelligence applications and Data Science development languages (R, Python, etc).
Familiarity with data visualization and self-service BI/data warehousing/ advanced analytics tools
Ability to lead design activities, and influence engineering and product directions
Ability to interact with external DBAs, data engineers, product managers, business
stakeholders and other technology leaders
Ability to influence across multiple organizational levels including senior leadership
Ability to interact with all levels of an organization
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Preferred Experience, Qualifications, and Skills


5+ years of direct responsibility for strategy formulation and/or business analytics, database management, data analytics, data integration, and database development
Experience in the FinTech space desirable.

Not for you? Check out other opportunities

To learn more about alternative career opportunities view our current openings that include positions available within our Technology, Talent, Growth, Marketing, and Customer Care teams.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

AvidXchange is an equal opportunity employer. AvidXchange is committed to equal employment opportunity in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. AvidXchange will not discriminate against applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis. This includes, but is not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age and physical or mental disability.

The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to improve strategic innovation for the federal government. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll mentor teammates, develop algorithms, write scripts, build predictive analytics, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help federal health organizations make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in the federal government.
Empower change with us.
You Have:3+ years of experience within a technical consultant role, including business development, software implementation, solutions management, or capture activitiesExperience with software development and engineering workflow management, leading Agile teams, or other technical project managementExperience with data science, machine learning, or data engineering, including in a technologist, consultant, or advisory roleKnowledge of analytics technologies and platforms, including machine learning, deep learning, big data, and cloud computingAbility to communicate complex technical ideas, designs, solutions, and their benefitsActive Top Secret clearanceBA or BS degree
Nice If You Have:Knowledge of standard design patterns for software, big data, and analytics systems and technologiesAbility to work with relevant reference architectures for customer needs and keep up with industry trends and changesMA or MS degree
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics, and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:
access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
a chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government
You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, onsite boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

BAE Systems is looking for a Senior Systems Engineer for their USMC Wargaming Center which will be developed and operated from our McLean VA location. This is a 2 year opportunity which will transition into a 5 year opportunity in the Quantico VA area. The Marines are building a new Wargaming facility on Quantico VA which will run 16 wargames a year and multiple classification levels. Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, will all be used to deliver state of the art wargaming capabilities to the USMC. This is a very exciting opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a large contract with a long future. Candidates do not need clearances at this time but will be submitted for TS/SCI clearance which will be need 2 years in the future when we move the Quantico location.

Required Skills and Education

Bachelors degree in related field with 9 years of experience
Provide Systems Engineering technical support.
Support systems engineering data design reviews.
Perform requirements assessments and requirements decomposition.
Model system behavior through functional flows and functional descriptions.
Support the development of interface control documents and interface description documents.
Support the development of systems engineering presentations and reports.
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Preferred Skills and Education

Masters Degree

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security

BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That’s BAE Systems. That’s Inspired Work.

Duties
Summary
See below

Responsibilities
Responsible for executing the guidance and directives of the Chief Management Officer (CMO); Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD); and Director, Office of Business Transformation (D,OBT) in implementing the provisions of Title 10 U.S. Code 2222 (defense business systems: architecture, accountability, and modernization) and the Government Performance & Results Act (GPRA) Modernization Act of 2010. Serves as the senior technical authority with responsibility for advising the Chief Management Officer; Deputy Chief Management Officer; Director, Office of Business Transformation; Deputy Director, Office of Business Transformation (DD, OBT); and other staff elements relative to portfolio management and investment planning for artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML/DS) capabilities. Provides expert counsel, advice and assistance for the development of Enterprise Architecture (EA) artifacts for AI/ML/DS products for the Business Mission Area (BMA) encompassing end-to-end business processes and supporting information technology and BMA enterprise architecture integration within the Army in coordination with the BMA's Chief Enterprise Architect. Plans, analyzes, reviews, coordinates, and integrates actions necessary to inject sound analytics into BMA decision-making with regard to the Army Business Enterprise Architecture and the associated information systems. Leads the Army Business Council (ABC) requirements review of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) recommendations from the Enterprise Business Systems Multi-Functional Capabilities Team pertaining to AI/ML/DS capabilities. Serves as a member of the Army Analytics Board - a multi-discipline team providing governance for a range of activities related to the design and development of data science and data analytics concepts, solutions, and analyses.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
00
Job family (Series)

Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Please read the vacancy announcement in its entirety before applying

You must be a U.S. citizen to qualify for this position.
You must be able to submit and pass designated and/or Random Drug Testing as required.
You must be able to obtain/maintain a Top Secret with SCI access clearance.

Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
Appointment is subject to the completion of a favorable suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a background investigation.
Direct Deposit of Pay is Required.
This position requires you to submit a Public Financial Disclosure Report (OGE 278e) upon entry, and annually thereafter.
The incumbent is required to travel on both scheduled and unscheduled aircraft, and other modes as required, under conditions specified under the DoD Joint Travel Regulations.
The incumbent is expected to travel on short notice to attend high level meetings to obtain resolution of problems and gather information to assist in the decision making process.

Qualifications
Applicants must submit written statements (narrative format) that address the following Technical Qualification(s). Failure to meet or address the mandatory Technical qualification(s) automatically disqualifies an applicant from consideration. **To meet the minimum qualification requirements for this position, you must show that you possess the Technical Qualification(s), and other qualifications, if applicable (such as Education - see below)**

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATION(S) (TQ) (MANDATORY SUBMISSION): A narrative statement specifically addressing each mandatory technical qualification. TQs must provide specific examples that address relevant experience and accomplishments. Total TQ write-up should not exceed 2 pages per TQ using 12pt, Arial or Times New Roman with 1 inch margins. Applicants must reflect superior technical qualifications demonstrated through leadership and management in the following:

MTQ 1: Demonstrated enterprise-level experience in effectively addressing senior leader and line of business strategic challenges with data-driven initiatives.


MTQ 2: Demonstrated enterprise-level experience leveraging deep business and technical expertise to lead multidisciplinary teams in the execution of strategic, operational and tactical analyses that drive on better outcomes for the enterprise.
Education
Educational Requirement: Degree in operations research; or at least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science, or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester hours must have been in calculus. Additional information on this requirement may be obtained at: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/operations-research-series-1515/.


FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html.
Additional information
If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.
False Statements: If you make a false statement in any part of your application, you may not be hired; you may be fired after you begin work; or you may be subject to fine, imprisonment, or other disciplinary action.
Non Discrimination: All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, marital status, political affiliation, age, sex, sexual orientation, disabling condition, membership in an employee organization, or any other non-merit factors.
Adverse Information Screening: Applicants proposed for selection are subject to inquiries as to any incidences of misconduct, malfeasance, neglect of duty, or the appearance thereof. Information gained in this check will be considered in the approval decision.
E-verify: If you are selected for this position, the documentation that you present for purposes of completing the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 will be verified through the DHS "E-Verify" system. Federal Law requires DHS to use the E-Verify system to verify the employment eligibility of all new hires, and obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system as a condition of continued employment. The U.S. Department of Army is an E-Verify Participant


How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
You will be evaluated on the quality and extent of your total accomplishments, experience, and education.

Your application will be evaluated by a rating and ranking panel. Highly qualified candidates may undergo an interview and a reference check. The Office of the Secretary of Army Executive Resources Board will review results and make recommendations on final selections to the appointing authority.

Your resume may be submitted in any format. If you submit more than one copy of your resume, only the most recent version will be reviewed. The latest timestamp will be used to determine which version of your resume is "most recent." It is your responsibility to check the status and timestamp of all documents you submit as part of your application.

For qualifications determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., HRS per week and month/year to month/year or month/year to present). If your resume does not contain this information, your application will be marked as incomplete and you will not receive consideration for this position.

2. Technical Qualification (MANDATORY SUBMISSION): A narrative statement specifically addressing each mandatory technical qualifications. If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further.

NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove another person's personal information before you submit your application. You may be asked to provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected to confirm your eligibility.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Frontend Developer
LOCATION: Denver, CO
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular/AngularJS
Bootstrap SCSS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms


Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation
GIS & Mapping
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium
Docker and Kubernetes
Java, C++ and other languages
AngularUI Bootstrap
Leaflet
Cesium
Grunt
SVGs
Jsonix
Browser Compatibility
Font Awesome
Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance.
We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share information with you once we are in discussions.
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Description/Job Summary
SBD is seeking a Senior Cybersecurity Systems Engineer to join our team in support of a federal customer in Washington, DC. The project team will be responsible for providing services to operate and maintain a comprehensive cybersecurity and privacy program. Included in this program are Security Architecture, Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC), Cyber Strategic Initiatives, and Privacy Program Support. These services are required to provide the customer with a sustainable organic proactive and reactive cybersecurity capability to protect their operating environment against a dynamic threat environment.
Responsibilities of the Senior Cybersecurity Systems Engineer include:
Support the customer's cybersecurity and privacy vision to affect governance and processes in order to provide access to modern, reliable, and secure Information Technology (IT) infrastructure and systems that support and enhance their mission to implement and maintain a comprehensive and effective cyber security program to protect the their information and IT assets
Enable mission programs and operations with effective cybersecurity technology products and information
Improve compliance with Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA) and all other cybersecurity Government-wide regulations, policies and procedures
Enhance audit readiness, remediation, and compliance capability
Utilize the suite of Continuous Diagnostic and Mitigation (CDM) tools and capabilities to protect the enterprise
Leverage Robotics and Artificial Intelligence to predict and reduce cybersecurity vulnerabilities and threats
Enhance the Data Protection program
Enhance Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) program

Reduce the complexity of the information technology (IT) and operations technology (OT) infrastructure using Enterprise Architecture concepts and models to consolidate, optimize, and standardize organizational systems, applications, and services

Reduce the complexity of systems by eliminating unnecessary functions and security and privacy capabilities that do not address security and privacy risk
Required Qualifications
Must have and maintain at least one of the following certifications: Network+ or CISSP - Information Systems Security Engineering Professional (ISSEP).

Must be able to travel to other customer sites within in the continental United States

Must be a US Citizen

Must be able to obtain an agency-specific Public Trust (NACI) clearance prior to starting

You…

You’ll leverage your Techno/Functional SME experience as a Senior Solutions Architect on a consulting team responsible for providing engineering support and implementation services for a leading federal agency’s IT modernization efforts.

In this role, you’ll be responsible for the overall technical approach and participate in implementation, as necessary. As a subject matter expert, you’ll leverage relevant application architecture experience, keeping your skills sharp and support other team members in gaining knowledge and trust in a well-defined architectural road map.

From identification, development, and refinement of the target architecture, transition plans from existing, requirements, priorities and development plans for next generation initiative to collaboration, coordination, review and analysis with all development, infrastructure and supporting teams, you’ll partner on all customer efforts including Front Office initiatives, all offices under OCIO as well as all Business Units to ensure consistency with architecture and technology, support of enterprise efforts and integration with supporting services.

Other responsibilities include maintain, and plan for, the long-term strategies and goals for the full scope of efforts including support for the architecture, requirements, integration and migration with current production systems, infrastructure, resolution of systemic issues, enterprise initiatives, priorities, resolution of issues and development plans, providing direction and guidance for emerging technologies, strategic and annual planning including alignment with the business architecture, identification of dependencies, overlaps and gaps and priorities of projects and provide solutions and mitigation strategies, reviewing and providing recommendations, presentations, strategy and guidance to the USPTO team, steering committees and senior management; and support executive briefings. Create/generate related reports and other documentation and ensuring all architecture efforts follow Enterprise Architecture, Standards, Guidelines and Policies including the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), and that documentation is in accordance with Section 508 requirements.

Us…

We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our client’s missions.

Program Mission…
This program will deliver support to the United States Patent & Trademark Office (with over a million Patent and Trademark applications submitted in 2017, a 50% increase since 2006) in its agency-wide transformation to adopt and implement innovative ways to continuously improve systems and processes. You’ll join a high performing team that embraces a culture to promote innovation, measurement and continuous improvement, and high-quality support services deliver business value and outcomes to our customers and partners.
Requirements…

Significant experience in solutioning, architecting, designing, migrating and operating an application environment.
Significant experience in providing system architecture and application architecture recommendations.
Experience with Cloud, Virtualized environments including both internal and external solutions, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS.
Experience with and/or in-depth knowledge of more than one Cloud platform (AWS, Azure, Google, etc.).
AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate (Professional strongly preferred).
Fluent in current and emerging software/hardware technologies in order to provide strategic recommendations.
A confident, self-directed, credible business and technology profile with drive and energy.
Excellent leadership, interpersonal, presentation and communication (written and oral) skills, and able to articulate ideas concisely.
Experience providing technical leadership and capabilities for proposal pursuits, white papers, presentations and other key initiatives.
Experience building effective working relationships at all levels and managing/mentoring teams to success.

Desired Skills…
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or SAFe Certification.
Experience with development methodologies including Agile, Waterfall and Devops.
Leading architecture, design, and development of applications and data storage for complex systems.
Enterprise Architecture, Service Oriented Architecture.
Search Technologies including SOLR/Lucene.
Big Data, Advanced Analytic Architecture, Artificial Intelligence (AI) Architecture.
Java.
UNIX (HP, AIX, Linux).
WebServers and tiered architectures, JavaEE (J2EE), JBoss, Spring.
Relational databases, SQL database implementations including MySQL, Oracle, DOA, Stored Procedures, and ORM.
Non-Relational databases, NoSQL.
ReSTful Web Services.
XML Technologies.
Configuration Management/Source Control/Build Automation.

Years of Experience: 15+ years of experience in IT infrastructure and enterprise level architectural engineering.

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a Federal Public Trust Clearance/Suitability, including a U.S. residency requirement for those who are Non-U.S. Citizens (Must have lived in the U.S. two out of the last 5 years).

Company Overview:
Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.

Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Job Summary:
We are looking for a Sr. Technical Revenue Accountant that will support Nuance's Healthcare division. This Senior Revenue Accountant will support the Senior Manager with deal support, contract reviews, documentation of revenue conclusions, revenue analytics, system and process improvements.

Primary Responsibilities:
Work with Sales, Professional Services, Legal, Divisional leader, Deal Desk and Technical Revenue Accounting (TRA) Senior Management to develop deal structures which accomplish customer objectives while yielding desired economics and accounting outcomes for Nuance
Review and document complex, multi-element sales contracts to support compliance with applicable authoritative literature
Prepare and review periodic studies (including Fair Value, customer life, etc.)
Manage and execute revenue key controls
Provide Senior Management with financial reporting information and operational support
Support continuous improvement of RevPro accounting system and revenue processes

Qualifications:

Education: Bachelors degree in Accounting/Finance

Minimum years of work experience: 3 or more years in Revenue Accounting position

Strong organizational and analytical skills
Ability to present data in a comprehensive and articulate manner

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. If you need an accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call 781-565-5086 and let us know.

Day in the Life of Senior Technology Engineer - Data - req12758:
State Farm is looking for a Senior Technology Engineer – Data in Bloomington to work on our Enterprise Technology Team. This individual must have a passion for Data and driving forward technologies and solutions that enables State Farm to build our competitive advantage and Unleash the Power of Data!
This is an awesome opportunity to work in our Enterprise Data Lake Account (EDLA) in AWS. Focus will be on the architecture design for scalability, data design, data access, data governance and data management. In partnership with the team aligned to EDLA, a typical day can include:
Ensure staying true to the target data architecture strategy
Quickly identify, design and build innovative solutions that will further enable EDLA capabilities
Ensure quality, integration and governance associated to the overarching requirements for EDLA
Be a champion in guiding communities in consuming the capabilities effectively

Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The primary role of the Sr. Analyst is to provide analytic support to one or more business areas within Life Sciences: Outcomes Research, Economic Modeling, Literature Review and Value Dossier, and Market Analytics. The Sr. Research Analyst not only has significant responsibility for analytic support of the research projects, but also supplements project management activities, provides input into the development of new business proposals, mentors junior staff, and assists with other on-going project work as needed.
This position can be located in multiple cities.


Preferred locations include: Cambridge, MA. - Ann Arbor, MI. - Bethesda, MD. - Greenwood Village, CO. - Cleveland, OH. Home-based option is possible.


Essential Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Outcomes Research, Market Analytics, Economic Modeling
Support Research Leaders in all aspects of projects including general project organization, day-to-day project management, and client communications
Attend all internal team/external client meetings and present at client meetings when requested
Develop study protocol/file specifications or model specifications/conceptual design for review by Research Leader/Lead Analyst and other members of project team
Work closely with Programmer on most effective way to implement complex methodologies and build study analytic file
Use Treatment Pathways to conduct analyses
Perform data investigation on diagnostic, descriptive, and statistical output throughout the course of each research project. Suggest and implement changes in methodology based on output review
Provide key support with reviewing published literature and conducting data/information abstraction research to identify, collect, and summarize data for building health economic models
Assume primary role in developing economic models including cost-effectiveness/cost-utility/budget-impact analyses using Microsoft Excel (with Visual Basic macros) and other modeling software, such as TreeAge Pro
Prepare deliverables for client presentation (final written reports, slide decks, technical memoranda, posters, podium presentations, and manuscripts)
Literature Review and Value Dossier
Perform literature reviews using electronic databases such as Medline and EMBASE, search the gray literature, assist in the preparation of research protocols, screen for relevance, retrieve articles, develop data abstraction tools, and perform article abstraction.
Analyze and interpret the literature to draft consolidated summaries in Microsoft Word or PowerPoint.
Write literature synthesis in Word or PowerPoint, providing interpretation of the literature and observations of patterns and trends identified in a body of evidence.
Draft global and AMCP value dossiers.
Support abstracts, posters and manuscripts development
Other Responsibilities
Fill in for Research Leader in their absence
Mentor/supervise junior Analyst staff to perform project tasks for client deliverables
Lead training and orientation sessions for new hires or others within IBM Watson Health
Support the development of new proposals or sales opportunities as requested by Research Leaders, including working with clients to help them appropriately formulate research questions
Participate in project process efficiency improvement initiatives

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Minimum 5 years healthcare and pharmaceutical industry experience with a focus on outcomes research using administrative claims, electronic medical records, other healthcare data, and/or economic modeling, narrative and systemic literature reviews, meta-analyses, and Global and AMCP value dossier. Relevant graduate degree (e.g., MPH or PhD) may substitute for work experience.
Working knowledge of data storage in relational and or flat file environments and how data is manipulated using SAS, R, or other similar languages
Ability to communicate with individuals at various levels within the organization and external clients in a leadership capacity
Outstanding critical thinking, questioning, and listening skills; superior attention to detail
Proven project management and consensus building experience
Time management skills for managing multiple individual and team tasks simultaneously while completing work within allocated time frames

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Front End Developer
LOCATION: Orlando, FL. Work Remote- work from home, anywhere USA is fine. Additional ideal cities to Orlando, FL are the Washington, DC area and Denver, CO. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front-End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend Developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular & AngularJS
Bootstrap SCSS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms


Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation
GIS & Mapping
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium
Docker and Kubernetes
Java, C++ and other languages
AngularUI Bootstrap
Leaflet
Cesium
Grunt
SVGs
Jsonix
Browser Compatibility
Font Awesome
Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Validate Sales Compensation payouts and ensure they align to plan design.

Strong verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to present efficiently and effectively to various levels of management.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for tackling a wide range of problems from natural language processing to timeseries prediction. You will work closely with software engineers to build incredible systems

ML packages like LightGBM and XGBoost
OpenFST
Elasticsearch
Required Skills, Knowledge & Experience
You have 5+ years of experience being a major machine learning contributor at a top company, hedge fund, or university
You have at least one core programming expertise, such as Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas), MATLAB, or R
You have experience with advanced machine learning methods
You possess strong statistical knowledge, intuition, and experience modeling real data
You demonstrate effective coding, documentation, and communication habits
You have a strong research acumen and experiment design skills
You have the ability and credibility to lead a team
You have a stellar ability to communicate even the most complicated methods and results to a broad, often non-technical audience
Several of the following terms should hold deep meaning for you: LSTM, lookahead bias, bagging, boosting, stacking, information retrieval, batch norm, entity recognition, bootstrapping, Glorot initialization, Kullback-Leibler divergence, GLOVE, SMAPE, HMM, MAP, exponential family, VC dimension, EM, L1, TD(Lambda)
How to Really Get Our Attention
Your GitHub/Kaggle profile shows a project or problems you’ve tackled
You have relevant research or publications
You are a specialist in deep learning in an academic setting or production-grade machine learning

About Kensho

Kensho uses machine learning, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and data visualization techniques to solve some of the hardest analytical problems and create breakthrough financial intelligence solutions for our parent company, S&P Global.

Kensho was founded in 2013 by Harvard & MIT alums and was acquired by S&P Global in 2018. Kensho continues to operate as a startup in order to maintain our distinct, independent brand and to promote our breakthrough, innovative culture. Our team of Kenshins enjoy a dynamic and collaborative work environment that runs autonomously from S&P, while leveraging the unparalleled breadth and depth of data and resources available as part of S&P Global.

As Kenshins, we pride ourselves on maintaining an innovative culture that depends on diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes future Kenshins with all experiences and perspectives. Kensho is headquartered in Cambridge, MA, with offices in New York City, Washington D.C. and Los Angeles.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Front End Developer
LOCATION: Remote- work from home, anywhere USA is fine. Ideal cities to Denver, CO (HQ) are the Washington, DC area and Orlando FL.
US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front-End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend Developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular & AngularJS
Bootstrap SCSS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms


Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation
GIS & Mapping
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium
Docker and Kubernetes
Java, C++ and other languages
AngularUI Bootstrap
Leaflet
Cesium
Grunt
SVGs
Jsonix
Browser Compatibility
Font Awesome
Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

Our mission is to make the best mental health tools radically accessible to everyone.

We're a venture-backed startup building a suite of products designed to help people around the world improve their moods. Indeed, Woebot Labs Inc was created to address the growing gap between demand for, and access to, quality and evidence-based mental health services. We set out to solve the problem of access by creating scalable solutions that are both efficacious and engaging.

Our research on and expertise in clinical interventions and implementation science, coupled with digital therapeutic translation work, and rare expertise in artificial intelligence and machine learning, helped establish and strengthen us as a company.

Woebot Labs Inc. was founded on the following principles:

Behavioral Health For Everyone: We believe that like physical fitness, emotional fitness is something that people can actively cultivate on a daily basis. Creating a cultural shift in this direction is a crucial pathway towards tackling the mental health crisis.
Academic Rigour By Design: We are committed to demonstrating outcomes and contributing to the field. In addition, we apply best practices from human subjects research to our users and the protection of their data.
Humans First: We practice person-centered product design principles. In essence, we listen to our users as well as pay attention to and design for their lived experience of mental health problems.

You will be a core member of the Research and Clinical Team, and will work with company stakeholders to help design and empirically evaluate our suite of digital therapeutic programs in national and international trials. You'll work with our Chief Clinical Officer, and be a key part of leading our Research & Behavioral Health Clinical efforts.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR CLINICAL TEAM:
You're excited to help us design, implement, and scale evidence-based digital therapeutics. You have the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams to bring Woebot's mission to life: scaling access to quality mental health tools for millions.

You will be at the forefront of an emerging industry in digital health and wellness while being at the intersection of consumer and regulatory products. You have the unique opportunity to help delineate Woebot into a premium offering which will ultimately become the new standard in digital therapeutics.

We have an expansive program of research, our product is in high demand, and we're excited to have people on our team that are just as passionate about mental health as we are.

How You'll Thrive

Ramping Up


Week 1 you'll enjoy a warm welcome from the team and meet with some of your key teammates.
In your first 3 weeks, you'll educate yourself on our research pipelines, clinical trials, and all of Woebot's current live content.

Support Research & Innovation


Day 30 you'll deeply understand Woebot's current programs of research and FDA product pipelines. To accomplish this you will meet with our CCO and the R&D team regularly.
You will gradually begin to lead and oversee our current clinical trials and associated academic / clinical partnerships. Ultimately you will run 2-3 studies at various places in their progression.
As you ramp up, you'll work cross functionally internally while collaborating & actively communicating with partners (professors, consultants, etc) at academic or other research institutions.
By Day 45 you're expanding our company's research portfolio so that we are poised to disseminate our evidence broadly with the masses (investors, commercialization strategy press, customers, and users)

Lead Our Clinical Trials


By Day 60 you're overseeing 2-3 studies (a mix of trials and case-series studies)
You'll lead IRB management, trial recruitment, and study protocol generation. You'll also eliminate potential study pitfalls before they occur and readily communicate all facets of study progress.
You're also leading our data analysis, interpretation, and archive maintenance efforts.

Be A Thought Partner With Leadership


By day 90, we expect you to publish scientific papers and manuscripts. These will become opportunities for you to also present at scientific conferences and virtual events.
Ultimately, you'll become a thought partner to our Chief Clinical Officer and leadership about instrumental studies of interest by sharing research and trends throughout the company.
You will also help prepare data (and leadership team) for press publications and interviews

Role Specific Competencies


Master's or PhD-level education in the field of psychology, epidemiology, statistics, public health or related field.
Expertise in multiple academic and/or commercial patient-reported outcomes development projects.
3+ years of experience in human clinical research; demonstrated experience in research design, data collection, managing data sets, qualitative data analysis, and psychometrics.
A record of peer-reviewed publications related to patient-reported outcomes measures.
Experience working directly with commercial and/or academic sponsors in identifying and conceptualizing patient reported outcome projects.
Industry experience in pharmaceutical outcomes research, epidemiology, HEOR, or data informatics a plus.
Proficiency with statistical software programs such as SAS, R, Stata, or SPSS.
Experience in running clinical trials w/in a wide variety of healthcare ecosystems: payers, universities, in collaboration with pharma, etc. Including budgeting and protocol generation.
History of acquiring their own funding from a wide variety of Federal/other resources.
Ideally psychometric assessment expertise (measure development and validation).

Our Core Values


Empathic: Place a high value on user-experience. Motivated to help others be successful.
Proactive & flexible: Hit the ground running. Even with ambiguity, you can get the job done.
Self-awareness and growth-mindset: Wants to learn and grow in the role.
High standards: Take pride in your work and apply high standards toward everything.
Strong work ethic: Work hard to get the job done.

Benefits


Competitive Salary
Stock Options
Flexible PTO
Health, Dental & Vision
Healthy Snacks & Meals
Employee Volunteer Program
Yoga
Meditation

Senior Business Intelligence Business Analyst (20013757)
Description
THE OPPORTUNITY
The Senior Business Intelligence Business Analyst (Sr. BI Business Analyst) will be someone who is extremely passionate about leveraging technology in order to extract and share analytics insights. He or she will be self-motivated and results-oriented and possess the ability to work independently, juggle multiple tasks, prioritize workload, and adhere to tight deadlines, within a collaborative team environment. The Senior BI Business Analyst is passionate about data driven decision making and has a proven history of leveraging technology to extract and share analytics insights. He or she is ready to share that experience and coach others in BI best practices to push their project and the BI organization as a whole to the next level of success.
WHAT YOU LL DO
Building prototypes for demonstration and illustration purposes for peer groups, business partners, or senior leaders.
Collaborating with other BI Analysts and Engineers around data architecture and systems.
Supporting peers and stakeholders as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in Chipotle's data
Acting as mentor and SME for other data consumers across the company.
Looking for opportunities to improve current processes or find efficiencies by applying industry best practices as a BI Analyst.
Maintaining a strong relationships with business partners and leaders
Work independently with stakeholders at all levels.
Clearly communicating and driving discussions on data and insights, context, and implications with business and technology partners.
Documenting and communicating technical specifications to ensure that proper and optimized techniques, queries, and final deliverables are understood and incorporated into data and analytics processes.
Set standards for team analysts and provide coaching to help others meet those standards
Maintain a healthy backlog for a BI scrum team
WHAT YOU LL BRING TO THE TABLE
Have a Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or related discipline. (Preferred)
5+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, working with data warehouses and business intelligence tools
Served in a senior BI role in an enterprise environment
Experience querying from and reporting with MS SQL server
Understanding of ETL processes and development
Understand data modeling practices and principals
Expertise in data visualization and visual best practices
Experience with enterprise data governance and security.
Experience working in an agile delivery environment as either a Scrum Master or Product Owner. Certification is a plus.
Experience using MS Power BI in an enterprise environment a plus.
Experience providing extensive requirement documentation including source-to-target documentation, entity relationship diagrams, and agile story writing
Experience leading requirements gathering sessions and workshops with an executive level audience
Proven ability to communicate effectively with both business and technical audiences
Restaurant industry experience a plus.

ABOUT CHIPOTLE

Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically-cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle had over 2,600 restaurants as of December 30, 2019, in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. With more than 83,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. Steve Ells, founder and executive chairman, first opened Chipotle with a single restaurant in Denver, Colorado in 1993. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM.

CULTIVATING A BETTER WORLD

Food served fast doesn t have to be a typical fast food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We're changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you'll join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.

Our mission is to make the best mental health tools radically accessible to everyone.

We're a venture-backed startup building a suite of products designed to help people around the world improve their moods. Indeed, Woebot Labs Inc was created to address the growing gap between demand for, and access to, quality and evidence-based mental health services. We set out to solve the problem of access by creating scalable solutions that are both efficacious and engaging.

Our research on and expertise in clinical interventions and implementation science, coupled with digital therapeutic translation work, and rare expertise in artificial intelligence and machine learning, helped establish and strengthen us as a company.

Woebot Labs Inc. was founded on the following principles:

Behavioral Health For Everyone: We believe that like physical fitness, emotional fitness is something that people can actively cultivate on a daily basis. Creating a cultural shift in this direction is a crucial pathway towards tackling the mental health crisis.
Academic Rigour By Design: We are committed to demonstrating outcomes and contributing to the field. In addition, we apply best practices from human subjects research to our users and the protection of their data.
Humans First: We practice person-centered product design principles. In essence, we listen to our users as well as pay attention to and design for their lived experience of mental health problems.

The Senior Research Scientist will be a core member of the Research and Clinical Team, and will work with company stakeholders to help design and empirically evaluate our suite of digital therapeutic programs in national and international trials. You'll work with our Chief Clinical Officer, and be a key part of leading our Research & Behavioral Health Clinical efforts. This individual's ability to drive research, innovation, & successful clinical trials will help our team achieve our goals of helping people around the world improve their mental health.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR CLINICAL TEAM:
You're excited to help us design, implement, and scale evidence-based digital therapeutics. You have the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams to bring Woebot's mission to life: scaling access to quality mental health tools for millions.

You will be at the forefront of an emerging industry in digital health and wellness while being at the intersection of consumer and regulatory products. You have the unique opportunity to help delineate Woebot into a premium offering which will ultimately become the new standard in digital therapeutics.

We have an expansive program of research, our product is in high demand, and we're excited to have people on our team that are just as passionate about mental health as we are.

How You'll Thrive

Ramping Up


Week 1 you'll enjoy a warm welcome from the team and meet with some of your key teammates.
In your first 3 weeks, you'll educate yourself on our research pipelines, clinical trials, and all of Woebot's current live content.

Support Research & Innovation


Day 30 you'll deeply understand Woebot's current programs of research and FDA product pipelines. To accomplish this you will meet with our CCO and the R&D team regularly.
You will gradually begin to lead and oversee our current clinical trials and associated academic / clinical partnerships. Ultimately you will run 2-3 studies at various places in their progression.
As you ramp up, you'll work cross functionally internally while collaborating & actively communicating with partners (professors, consultants, etc) at academic or other research institutions.
By Day 45 you're expanding our company's research portfolio so that we are poised to disseminate our evidence broadly with the masses (investors, commercialization strategy press, customers, and users)

Lead Our Clinical Trials


By Day 60 you're overseeing 2-3 studies (a mix of trials and case-series studies)
You'll lead IRB management, trial recruitment, and study protocol generation. You'll also eliminate potential study pitfalls before they occur and readily communicate all facets of study progress.
You're also leading our data analysis, interpretation, and archive maintenance efforts.

Be A Thought Partner With Leadership


By day 90, we expect you to publish scientific papers and manuscripts. These will become opportunities for you to also present at scientific conferences and virtual events.
Ultimately, you'll become a thought partner to our Chief Clinical Officer and leadership about instrumental studies of interest by sharing research and trends throughout the company.
You will also help prepare data (and leadership team) for press publications and interviews

Role Specific Competencies


Master's or PhD-level education in the field of psychology, epidemiology, statistics, public health or related field.
Expertise in multiple academic and/or commercial patient-reported outcomes development projects.
3+ years of experience in human clinical research; demonstrated experience in research design, data collection, managing data sets, qualitative data analysis, and psychometrics.
A record of peer-reviewed publications related to patient-reported outcomes measures.
Experience working directly with commercial and/or academic sponsors in identifying and conceptualizing patient reported outcome projects.
Industry experience in pharmaceutical outcomes research, epidemiology, HEOR, or data informatics a plus.
Proficiency with statistical software programs such as SAS, R, Stata, or SPSS.
Experience in running clinical trials w/in a wide variety of healthcare ecosystems: payers, universities, in collaboration with pharma, etc. Including budgeting and protocol generation.
History of acquiring their own funding from a wide variety of Federal/other resources.
Ideally psychometric assessment expertise (measure development and validation).

Our Core Values


Empathic: Place a high value on user-experience. Motivated to help others be successful.
Proactive & flexible: Hit the ground running. Even with ambiguity, you can get the job done.
Self-awareness and growth-mindset: Wants to learn and grow in the role.
High standards: Take pride in your work and apply high standards toward everything.
Strong work ethic: Work hard to get the job done.

Benefits


Competitive Salary
Stock Options
Flexible PTO
Health, Dental & Vision
Healthy Snacks & Meals
Employee Volunteer Program
Yoga
Meditation

Woebot is an equal opportunity employer and we deeply value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

COMPANY: Stilman Advanced Strategies
POSITION: Senior Front End Developer
LOCATION: Washington, DC area. Work remote- work from home, anywhere USA is fine. Additional ideal cities to Washington, DC are Denver, CO and Orlando FL. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance during early employment which we sponsor.

Company Overview
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.

Our small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.

The Role: Senior Front-End Developer
We are looking to bring on one or more additional Senior Frontend Developers to work on the primary user interface - web app that leverages modern UI technologies, UX concepts, GIS/mapping, communications protocols, data formats, and military concepts. This web app encompasses a large feature set for map-centric scenario construction and editing, 2D and 3D animated visualization, real time collaboration, analytics, integration with other UI and backend systems. Yet we make sure that the user experience for both basic and advanced users is as smooth as possible, little training is needed, and the officers can intuitively use the tool to help them think about tactics rather than spending their time thinking about how to use the tool.
You will take part in design of new UI/UX for new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of front end software using Angular, Bootstrap, Leaflet, and Cesium, performance optimization, work with backend COA-generation software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, help model military concepts in software, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find best ways to integrate our systems.

Key Experience to Have
JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Angular & AngularJS
Bootstrap SCSS
Performance Optimization
Data Structures and Algorithms


Great Experience to Have
Modeling & Simulation
GIS & Mapping
Mercurial, Git, SVN
CI/CD, Jenkins, Selenium
Docker and Kubernetes
Java, C++ and other languages
AngularUI Bootstrap
Leaflet
Cesium
Grunt
SVGs
Jsonix
Browser Compatibility
Font Awesome
Military concepts and tactics
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles.

Benefits & Other
We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance. US Citizenship is required. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. This is a full time employee hire to Stilman, working in partnership with Talent Architect Rick Powell, Fractional Recruiter. We fly under the radar on social media but will be glad to share more information with you once we are in discussions. Thanks for considering Stilman Advanced Strategies for your next career move!
